title: Please help, I have been receiving a login queue error for upwards of 2 months and can't fix it.
body:
Dear Riot,
I have been receiving this error that I can't connect to the login queue for League of Legends for quite some time and have been through every type of troubleshooting forums that you have to offer, my internet connection is fine running upwards of 75 mbps for both upload and download speeds. I dont understand why I am still unable to connect to your servers and would greatly appreciate help and feedback on my issues with logging in. I have tried the hextech repair tool, repairing my client, uninstalling and reinstalling league,  deleting specific parts of the config file according to some forums, and a few other things. Thank you for your help.
-Ethan

replies.body: There's a number of different things that can block your network from reaching our servers like firewalls or antivirus, so let's start there. I know you mentioned having gone through a lot of the troubleshooting guides, but I want to make sure we cover all of our bases so let's start by checking up on your [**network settings**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues). Let me know if you're able to get logged in after adjusting your firewalls and DNS settings.
Yeah, I just completely turned off all my firewalls and still nothing. Any other ideas that may work?

Let's go ahead and get you a little more personalized help to get this fixed up as quickly as possible. Reach out to out tech guys in a [**ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) or live chat, and they'll be able to look over your game logs and walk you through a few more troubleshooting steps!
